course_title: Special Topics in Music: Bach's Well-Tempered Clavier
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 16 / Seats Avail: 3Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
This course looks in depth at Bach's Well-Tempered Clavier, a universally acknowledged musical landmark in the history of western music. The course consists of careful analysis of individual pieces from the 48 preludes and fugues comprising the two-volume keyboard work, with additional secondary supplied by the instructor. The required text is any practical edition of Well-Tempered Clavier I & II. Course grade will be based on short weekly written assignments, two tests, and two papers. Students must be able to read music. 
Music majors: fulfills a music-major general elective.
course_description: Seminar or lecture series of topics in music. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
